title: Does Shared Decision-Making Support Value-Based Care Models?
description: Policy experts from the Urban Institute argue that shared decision-making requirements would be effective in value-based care models for cancer care.

title: Book a solutions demo with nThrive at the 2017 ACDIS Annual Conference
description: Visit the nThrive booth and participate in a solution demo. Spin the wheel for charity and we will make a donation on your behalf!

title: How population health tools can better manage infectious disease
description: IT initiatives can be part of the new strategy needed to help the nation deal with emerging outbreaks, before they threaten people's lives.

title: CMS now posting public health, registry EHR readiness data
description: Long-awaited tool helps providers assess ability of agencies, registries to accept MU data electronically.

title: FCC seeks information about broadband-enabled healthcare
description: The federal agency has asked the healthcare and broadband industries how it should promote connected healthcare technologies, which could improve telehealth infrastructure and other innovations.

title: Great turnout at the nThrive breakfast symposium at NAHAM 2017!
description: Book your solution demonstration with nThrive today at NAHAM 2017

title: Physicians ask the CMS to cut Medicare red tape
description: Doctors want the CMS to better sync policies for Medicare Advantage, Medicare fee-for-service and ACOs to help cut their regulatory burden.

title: Wake Forest Baptist contracts with nThrive for outpatient billing; medical center says no jobs lost
description: Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center announced Tuesday that it has entered into an agreement with nThrive for professional billing services starting July 1, affecting 630 to 650 employees.

title:
nThrive and Aloft Group Win "Best Creative" HITMC
Award in Recognition of Rebrand
description:
The award recognized the excellent creative strategy that was behind the rebrand of MedAssets, Precyse and Equation into nThrive, which was launched mid-2016 and has now grown to comprise two additional acquisitions,
Adreima and e4e.

title: RCM tip of the day: Seek out a strategic partner, not just a vendor
description: Healthcare organizations should strive to find a strategic revenue cycle management partner, according to Sloan Clardy, chief strategy officer for nThrive.

title: MACRA, Value-Based Care and the Quality Payment Program
description: What is MACRA? What is the Quality Payment Program? Learn more about MACRA, value-based care and the QPP at nThrive.com.

title: 2017 NAHAM Annual Conference
description: Book a solution demonstration at NAHAM! Visit nThrive booth #423 to learn how our integrated patient access technology and service solutions will help your organization: • Provide accurate patient estimates • Improve point-of-service cash collections • Improve patient satisfaction • Empower your staff and improve workflow processes • Achieve profitable revenue growth

title: nThrive Cancer Registry Services
description: nThrive cancer registry services and oncology data management can help compile and safeguard cancer patient data, potentially helping to improve their lives.
meta_description: nThrive cancer registry services and oncology data management can help compile and safeguard cancer patient data, potentially helping to improve their lives.

title: nThrive recognizes National Cancer Registrar Week
description: Cancer registrars throughout the world will join their colleagues, fellow medical professionals, and community leaders to observe the 21st annual National Cancer Registrars Week (NCRW), April 10-14, 2017. The purpose of NCRW is to emphasize the important role cancer registrars play in capturing the data that informs cancer research, prevention, and treatment programs. The theme for 2017 is Cancer Registrars: Putting the Pieces Together.

title: 8 pieces of advice on improving claim collection rates
description: nThrive's Bill Knox, Vice Presdient of Product Management featured in Becker's HR Advice on Improving Claim Collection Rates. With the rise of high-deductible health plans and pressure on reimbursement rates, many hospitals and health systems are trying to improve collection rates to maintain or boost their financial performance. Here, revenue cycle experts share their advice on how organizations can improve collections, both from payers and patients.

title: Why analytics alone won't bend healthcare's cost curve
description: Advanced analysis with augmented intelligence can ask millions of questions at once, finding patterns that give clinicians clues for improving care to address expensive illnesses.

title: RCM tip of the day: Look for a partner that's independent
description: Hospitals and health systems must consider a number of areas when choosing a revenue cycle management partner.

title: Delay of Effective Date for Comprehensive Care for Joint Replacement and Cardiac Bundles
description: Public Inspection: Medicare Program: Advancing Care Coordination Through Episode Payment Models (EPMs); Cardiac Rehabilitation Incentive Payment Model; and Changes to Comprehensive Care for Joint Replacement Model; Delay of Effective Date

title: RCM tip of the day: Ditch your singular revenue cycle solutions for a holistic approach
description: Hospitals and health systems have various options when bringing in additional guidance to improve their revenue cycle. These options include contracting with multiple partners or a single vendor. Steve Huddleston, president and chief client officer at nThrive: Recent healthcare trends have made it imperative that healthcare organizations drive revenue and accelerate cash flow in a sustainable way.

title: Report: Information Management in EHRs, Use of CDS are Top Patient Safety Concerns
description: Healthcare providers have troves of information to manage, and the advent of electronic health records (EHRs) has brought this challenge to the forefront, which is why the ECRI Institute cited information management in EHRs as its top patient safety concern in its annual executive brief.

title: Expanding Beyond HIPAA Audit Prep for Information Governance
description: AHIMA recently released a toolkit to assist with OCR HIPAA audit preparation, but it is only one key area for covered entities to review.

title: HIPs Week - Leading the way to quality data
description: AHIMA invites all health information professionals to join the celebration and be recognized during the 28th annual HIP Week! This year's theme is: Health Informational Professionals – Leading the way to quality data

title: 2017 AMY Awards
description: The AMY Awards recognize companies and individuals who've made their mark on the Atlanta marketing scene during the previous calendar year.

title: What is Patient to Payment?
description: What do we mean when we say Patient-to-Payment? Health care solutions that aid providers throughout the entire revenue cycle process.

description: A recent AHIMA report reviews HIPAA compliance and patient data access, emphasizing the importance of patient data access in improving patient engagement.

title: RCM vendor leaders to know in 2017

title: MACRA Quality Payment Program's first performance period gets underway
description: Clinicians want to know if they are eligible for MIPS and CMS will soon be notifying them of their status, says Kate Goodrich, MD.

title: Healthcare Orgs Struggle to Meet EHR, Big Data Workforce Needs
description: Providers and vendors are both struggling to secure top-quality big data analytics and EHR optimization talent to help them achieve their health IT goals

title: Why consumers feel health data is vulnerable to hackers
description: Nearly half fear breaches, but most believe data sharing could aid care, says Cees Van Doorn.
